column5: http://www.geteskimo.com/foundations/store...asp?category=52  Any feedback...I'm in the market and they are $150 cheaper than the jiffy.  Thanks

I've had an eskimo barracuda for about 8 years now. No major troubles other than in REALLY cold (-30) temps we had about 7 years ago it wouldn't start...guys around me with jiffy's had no problem. When the sun warmed things to around -15 it worked. Stalls out once in a while but that may be my gas mixture or some other setting I haven't adjusted. All in all its been ok, not fantastic, but fine.
So you're saying there's no point in you coming ice fishing with the lads and I Roger...

I had a eskimo 3hp 85 cc 10 inch auger for 14 years. Never had a problem with it. I sold it last spring for 300 bucks,I paid 350 for it brand new.Only reason I sold it was my father was selling his brand new still in the box jiffy for the same 300 bucks.
I was just in Canadian Tire and both the jiffy 30 8 inch and eskimo viper are on sale. The difference in price is only 40 bucks. 339 for eskimo and 379 for the jiffy.
Which Canadian Tire Store di you see them at?
Costco has the Eskimo Viper 8" for $299.
yipes thats cold Wayne. I'll be there in the cold, just don't count on me to drill any holes! When she warms up I'll turn the lake to swiss cheese
